action.action-desc: Mr. Sensenbrenner (for himself, Mr. Smith of Texas, and Mr. Ryan of Wisconsin) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives regarding the conditions for the United States becoming a signatory to any international agreement on greenhouse gas emissions under the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change.

section.text: That it is the sense of the House of Representatives that the United States should not be a signatory to any protocol to, or other agreement regarding, the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change of 1992, at negotiations in Paris in December 2015, or thereafter, which wouldâ€”

paragraph.text: mandate new commitments to limit or reduce greenhouse gas emissions for the Annex I Parties, unless the protocol or other agreement also mandates new specific scheduled commitments to limit or reduce greenhouse gas emissions for Non-Annex I Parties within the same compliance period;
not ensure that all parties to the agreement reduce an equal amount of greenhouse gas emissions at an equivalent rate within the same compliance period;
result in serious harm to the economy of the United States; and
not adequately protect United States intellectual property rights.
